title: >>> ONE Step CLOSER
body_text:
DODGEBALL 9, DODGEBALL 19, and DODGEBALL 29: three events that helped shape the course of history, all leading into the climatical "seasonal" end to dodgeball. Those events launched all players into what are known as the "ten" events. The "ten" events, for those who have yet to experience one, are considered by many to be the best of the best for a number of reasons. With that said, a short stroll down memory lane in preparation for DODGEBALL 39 and its following can perhaps provide a glimpse into the future ...
DODGEBALL 9
DODGEBALL 9 certainly had its share of fun and surprises. Many in attendance can still remember the blue light that filled the sky do to what appeared to a blast. That blast caused the event end prematurely as the lights immediately shut off at around 9:45. To this day, it is still debated as to what exactly happened. Whatever the case, the windy and wet weather provided a solid night of action on October 22nd. The second "Wet War" was only a prelude for events to come.
Date: October 22nd, 2005
Attendance: 19
Location: Ocean Road Park
Captains: Chris Adams vs. John Tronolone
DODGEBALL 19
In what was one of the most physically draining events ever still turned out to be a real success. It was night two in the third ever "double header", following the memorable DODGEBALL 18 one night before. Two of the most hard-hitting throwers ever squared off in one-on-one captains competition. A war for the ages when the "Fitz" defeated "The Big Kat".
As the event concluded, the two-week wait period began to what is viewed by many as the greatest dodgeball event of all time, DODGEBALL 20.
Date: December 17th, 2005
Attendance: 28
Location: Wall High School
Captains: Zach Katz vs. Kevin Fitzpatrick
DODGEBALL 29
It seems like only yesterday that the "Ultimate Poster Contest" results were revealed. With the excitement surrounding the results also brought along a raffle, with the winner of the raffle, Alison Bertsch, granted a picture with poster contest champion, the legendary Justin Pierce. The event then turned to turmoil when captains were not mutually agreed upon by many of the competitors. The charismatic Steve Adams voiced his opinion as to who he thought we the two men fit for such a job. Zach Katz was at it again at "nine" event, only his opponent this time was soon-to-be "Allied Powers" award winner Travis Mills. This would be the final dodgeball event to take place at Wall High School in "Season 3".
Date: March 4th, 2006
Attendance: 30
Location: Wall High School
Captains: Zach Katz vs. Travis Mills
Will the Patterns Continue?
All eyes are on this Saturday, the extravaganza known as DODGEBALL 39. Past history has certainly shown some patterns with these classic events:
> All "nine" events have taken place on a Saturday.
> All "nine" attendances have been lower than the following "ten" event.
> Diana DiBuccio, Mike "Sputz" Krott, John Tronolone, Lauren Freda, Dan Spengeman, Valerie Winston, and all four of the Adams brothers have ever missed a "nine" event.
> John Watters, despite having a solid attendance, has never participated at a "nine" event.
> "Nine" events are famous for bringing in very few new players. A total of only four players have debuted at such events: Juan T (9), Tom H (19), Anthony F (29), and Katie H (29).
DODGEBALL 39
With a 6:30 start time, there is no telling what can be expected come this Saturday night. Will the patterns continue or is a drastic change in store?
...........
DODGEBALL 40 ... Coming to Wall High School, May 20th! Be there live at 6pm and be apart of all the excitement!
